children.text:
User Requirements Document (URD) objective is presenting a clear definition of the needs (top-level requirements) relative to BeetleSat constellation space segment, from an agnostic point of view (i.e. not initially considering any specific solution). 

The requirements shall reflect the actual needs of all relevant stakeholders for ensuring a successful product development. In addition, top-level requirements shall be complete, unambiguous, verifiable and coherent, as all project decisions/solutions will be taken for complying with these requirements. 

This URD is applicable to Arquimea Space as prime contractor for BeetleSat constellation and other potential opportunities related with the platform developed for BeetleSat purposes. This document is the baseline for the final preparation of the space segment specification by the prime contractor.

children.heading: Syntax rules and requirements definition guides

children.text:
With the objective of defining correct and coherent requirements, in this section the syntaxis rules followed in this document are presented. 

 

"Shall", "Will" and "Should" utilisation in this document

  • Shall is used to indicate a requirement that is contractually binding, meaning it must be implemented, and its implementation verified. "Shall" use, in this document, will follow EARS (Easy Approach to Requirements Syntax) pattern as described below.
  • Will is used to indicate a statement of fact. Will statements are not subject to verification.
  • For example, if I want to make a statement about another system not related with the scope of the work: “The XYZ system will be delivered to the vendor before KO of the project”. Or for providing description of something that already exists. 
  • Should  is used for desirable requirements.
  • Must is not used in this document as there is not clear difference w.r.t. "shall", for clarity and uniformity only shall will be used. 
  • May or can should be avoided if possible for clarity, but in case of use, they should be used as following RD-1 recommendations:
  • The verbal form “may” shall be used whenever a provision is a permission.
  • The verbal form “can” shall be used to indicate possibility or capability


EARS (Easy Approach to Requirements Syntax) rules 

The clauses of an EARS requirement always appear in the same order. The basic structure of an EARS requirement is: While, when, the shall

The EARS ruleset states that a requirement must have: 

  • Zero or many preconditions; 
  • Zero or one trigger; 
  • One system name; 
  • One or many system responses.

Applying the EARS notation produces requirements in a small number of patterns, depending on the clauses that are used. Each of the EARS patterns are explained below.

  • Ubiquitous requirements are always active and have the following structure: The shall for example The mobile phone shall have a mass of less than XX grams.
  • State driven requirements are active as long as the specified state remains true, are denoted by the keyword While and have the following syntax While , the shall for example While there is no card in the ATM, the ATM shall display “insert card to begin”.
  • Event driven requirements specify how a system must respond when a triggering event occurs, are denoted by the keyword When and have the following syntax When , the shall for example: When “mute” is selected, the laptop shall suppress all audio output.
  • Optional feature requirements apply in products or systems that include the specified feature, are denoted by the keyword Where and have the following syntax Where , the shall for example: Where the car has a sunroof, the car shall have a sunroof control panel on the driver door.
  • Unwanted behavior requirements are used to specify the required system response to undesired situations, are denoted by the keywords If and Then and have the following syntax If , then the shall for example: If an invalid credit card number is entered, then the website shall display “please re-enter credit card details”.
  • The simple building blocks of the EARS patterns can be combined to specify requirements for richer system behaviour. Requirements that include more than one EARS keyword are called Complex requirements and have the following syntax While , When , the shall for example: While the aircraft is on ground, when reverse thrust is commanded, the engine control system shall enable reverse thrust. Complex requirements for unwanted behavior also include the If-Then keywords.


In addition to the previous syntax rules, the requirements defined in this document shall follow the recommendations defined in RD-1 section 8.2 in relation to requirements ambiguity, uniqueness, singularity, etc.


A Requirements Management software tool is used for the traceability and maintainability of the requirements included in this document. Requirement ID is automatically assigned by the CAD tool. 

For those requirements including a list of elements, each element will be referenced with the ID of the general requirement and the item number in the list. Each item of the list will be treated as an independent requirement for verification purposes.

children.heading: Definitions
children.text: For clarification, definition for more relevant terms used in this document are herein included. Nevertheless, RD-2 can be used for other terminology when not specifically herein inlcuded.
Satellite or Spacecraft. Vehicle prepared for travel and operation in a planet orbit. The satellite or spacecraft is composed by a BUS/platform and payloads.
Bus or platform: set of subsystems (including structure) that provides the necessary support functions for the payload in particular and for the mission fulfilment in general
Payload: instrument(s) onboard a satellite that performs the key functions of the mission and represents the main source of revenue.

Qualification Satellite. Fully operational satellite that will be used for verifying (mainly by test means using qualification levels) the design, manufacturing, assembly and integration of the BeetleSat platform for the BeetleSat constellation. Also serving as a basis for the mass production of the space segment of the constellation.
USL (User Satellite link): Part of the payload that performs the link that will be dedicated to connecting each satellite with the ground segment (user terminals, ground stations or gateways)

ISL (Inter Satellite Link): Part of the payload that performs the link that will be dedicated to connecting neighbouring satellites (across same and neighbouring orbits) in order to route the traffic throughout the constellation network.

OAP (Orbit Average Power): average power consumption for all the mission cycles, which is obtained by first calculating the average value for each orbit and then for all of the orbits that will be performed for the duration of the mission

LEOP (Launch and Early Operations Phase): phase that includes launch, separation from launcher, orbit injection operations on board and at ground stations (including spacecraft deployment at final orbits within the constellation) and validation to make the spacecraft fully operational by activating, monitoring and controlling the different subsystems

Verification: process which demonstrates through the provision of objective evidence that the product is designed and produced according to its specifications and the agreed deviations and waivers, and is free of defects. It can be accomplished by one or more of the following methods: analysis (including similarity), test, inspection, review of design.
Validation (product): process which demonstrates that the product is able to accomplish its intended use in the intended operational environment (with verification as a pre-requisite)
children.comments:
As declared in ESA ECSS

DG->Verification makes sure the product is designed following the specification whereas validation makes sure the product accomplishes its intended use in the relevan environment.  Validation is always done by test.

children.text: Qualification test (system level): verification process that demonstrates that hardware fulfil all specified requirements under simulated conditions more severe than those expected during the mission

Acceptance test: test to determine that a system, subsystem, component or functional part is capable of meeting performance requirements prescribed in purchase specifications or other documents specifying what constitutes the adequate performance capability for the item and to demonstrate the item is free from manufacturing defects

NOC (Network Operation Center): main element of the constellation network, it is the infrastructure needed to operate the network so that the communications service can be provided to the customers. The satellite network is composed of nodes (satellites), terminals and gateways (TBC).

SOC (Satellite Operation Center): infrastructure (different from the NOC one) needed to control the operation of the satellites,  that processes TT&C data and gives information on the satellite status, performs its tracking and controls it by sending commands, all of it via the GCS (Ground Control Station).

TT&C (Telemetry, Tracking and Command): refers to the downlinked platform data giving details of the satellite’s subsystems status (telemetry), determination of its location through tracking ranging signals, and the uplinked commands given to the spacecraft
GCS (Ground Control Station): stations scattered all over the world that communicate directly with the satellites  (only for TT&C data)
Resource Manager/Planner: Service that deals with the calculation of route plans and the allocation of resources for a service.
NMS (Network Management System): System responsible of providing the communication service. It deals with the network management and is run on the NOC infrastructure.
TBD: In the scope of this document means that the referred item remains “to be defined.”

TBC: In the scope of this document means that the parameter or value of the requirement shall be verified by the prime contractor who may propose an alternative value. However the final value shall be subject to the agreement of customer
Space Segment: It comprises all the constellation satellites, the uplink and downlink satellite links with Ground Segment and the Inter Satellite Links between satellites.

Material Review Board (MRB): The Material Review Board or MRB is a board that consists of authorized supplier quality and engineering members that are needed to review, evaluate, and determine the proper disposition of nonconforming material referred to it.
The Work: The scope of the activities required for the completion of the project under the contract terms and conditions.

Software Defined Radio (SDR): An SDR is a radio communication platform that enables high processing capabilities using software in an embedded system. The embedded system features software functions and protocols that essentially replace various hardware components in traditional products.

Prime Contractor: A Prime Contractor is an ultimate and total responsible contractor for the completion of the works or a project under the contract terms and conditions. The Prime Contractor can utilise the contractor, subcontractor, or hire people for specific parts of the work and manage them.

Key Personnel: Individuals who perform essential functions in the project, experts in specific areas, that may be the only ones in the organisation who know how to complete specific tasks, or who have information about a specific part of your business.

Beetlesat (company) is planning to deploy a small-satellite, high-capacity, Low Earth Orbit (LEO) constellation for connectivity applications, named BeetleSat.

BeetleSat constellation will provide global Point-to-Point (P2P) and Internet Access connectivity to fix or mobile high-end users in Ka band, using LEO (Low Earth Orbit) constellation with geographic coverage between latitudes of ±62° (TBC) and allowing inter-satellite routing. BeetleSat spacecrafts will include in their payload:

·        A Software Define Radio (SDR) plus a router.

·        Inter-satellite Links (ISL) in Ka band, enabling efficient, reliable, and continuous communication globally.

·        USL…

BeetleSat is focused on:

·        Provide a complementary layer of high throughput, focused service, filling the unmet demand of telecommunication connectivity

·        BeetleSat’s intelligent network can allocate bandwidth to areas with high traffic demand, such as:

o   Clustered, high-density service areas

o   Aviation: airport hubs

o   Maritime: cruise ships, super yachts, cargo ship ports 

o   Trunking/Backhaul: 4G/5G cellular towers 

o   MilSatCom: satcom on the move (SOTM) point-to-point links, satcom on the pause (SOTP) point-to-point links

o   Enterprise: multi-national corporations, oil and gas, embassies 

Performances: BeetleSat constellation main performances aim to: 

·        Service availability: ≥99% for the entire link 

·        Bitrate: at least 2Gbps per user terminal

·        Latency: depend on distance <150msec when various satellites are involved ISL; <35ms for just 1 satellite involved.

·        Each satellite has 4x ISL: 

o   ISLs incorporate 85cm (TBC) foldable antenna towards 4 neighbour satellites

§  BeetleSat proprietary unique technology 

§  2x in-orbit (within the satellite orbit) and 2x cross-orbit (neighbor orbits) links

o   Each link: BW of 1/1GHz (uplink/downlink), Average throughput of ~3.8Gbps

o   23/27GHz Ka band

The overall system architecture is as follows:

·        Each user beam serves single or multiple ground terminals or GWs

·        Terminals and GW are connected via USL and ISL links

·        Interconnectivity with other satellite networks (LEO/MEO/GEO) via ISL links

The NOC is connected to the grid through a terminal or GW and manages all the system elements: Satellites, GWs and Terminals

children.text:
The PA plan shall consider at least the following topics:

  1. Qualifications and training required for the personnel involved in performing operations
  2. Mandatory Inspections Points (MIP) and Key Inspection Points (KIP)
  3. Non-conformance issue handling
  4. QA program for the verification stage
  5. Procurement from third parties monitoring
  6. Configuration management control and tracking
  7. Space standards that shall be used, in each case, during the design, manufacturing, assembly, integration, tests and transportation of the space segment of the BettleSat constellation.  
  8. Design and qualification margins and factors
  9. Procedures for identification and control of Single Points of Failure, critical items, including critical software
  10. FMECA management processes
  11. Cleanliness control
  12. Material directives for its use in the space segment (e.g. out-gassing,  radiation and others as specified in the PA plan)
  13. Define OBSW critical levels
  14. Procedures for identification critical software involved in any part of the project and evaluate its criticality 
  15. Critical SW specific control and assurance procedures
  16. Margin and safety factors policy

FA->Not clear what NSL meant with this requirement. End-of-life satellite reliability for the de-orbiting phase? Shouldn´t be the same than the spacecraft? Should we remove it?

MC->Guess they want to ensure certain confidence level for the de-orbiting. Review if FCC says anything at this respect.

children.text: The satellite shall be designed to meet all safety requirements of the selected launch vehicle agencies including approved waivers

The satellite shall be designed so that when operated in conjunction with its ground support equipment, airborne support equipment, launch vehicle,  the user segment or the ground control centre, the probability of unsafe responses shall be minimized, particularly those related to items as propulsion thruster, pyrotechnic devices, thrusters, and any safety critical item.
children.comments: FA->Derived from AA´s doc. We maybe should modify list of particularities for the case of a smallsat.

children.text: All nominal subsystems, equipment and items or their redundant must be available for use at any time during the entire mission.

Single point failures, defined as single part or unit failures which could cause permanent loss of one or more spacecraft functions, shall be minimized and shall be demonstrated by means of FMECA analysis.
children.comments: FA->Derived from Antonio Abad´s document

children.text: All unavoidable single point of failure items shall be treated as reliability critical following PA plan
children.comments: FA->Derived from Antonio Abad´s document

children.text: Failure isolation shall be provided for all units so that a failure within one subsystem does not disable or degrade the performance of the satellite.
children.rationale: Failure propagation shall be analysed and minimised

children.text: Constellation shall comply with ITU regulations.
Constellation shall comply with ITU filling TBD
children.comments:
FA-> the project shall be in accordance with an pacific ITU filling isn´t it? once defined we shall consider it for the detailed requirements definition

MC->Should be concreted. It is a critical point
children.rationale: ITU filling conditions the space segment design

children.text: Space Segment design shall be compliant with the Federal Communications Commision Second Report and Order, IB Docket Nos. 22-271 and 18-313 for Mitigation of Orbital Debris in the New Space Age.
children.comments: FA->Any other de-orbiting regulation  shall we comply with? It should be MANDATORY? I think this is relevant considering the increment of concern in the society and governments related with the in-orbit debris, so maybe in the future there are more restrictive conditions related with this, better to include already the recommendations just in case in the future would be mandatory?
children.rationale: De-orbiting regulations for mitigation of space debris conditions the spacecraft design

children.text: The Prime Contractor shall ensure the Work is performed in compliance with the current national regulations of the countries where the Work is executed.
children.comments: FA-> for considering from the start that national regulations are in line with he work to be done

children.text: When physical elementes are transported between countries Prime Contractor shall comply with the transportation safety regulations applicable in each case.
children.comments: FA-> special care w.r.t safety transportation regulations

children.text: The use of ITAR components shall be avoided
When ITAR components are used, the Prime Contractor shall justify the reason for its use and demonstrate no other ITAR-free component could have being used instead.
BeetleSat spacecraft shall be compatible with a circular type of orbit
BeetleSat spacecraft shall be compatible for an altitude between 500-1000Km
children.comments: FA-> Specific altitude shall be defined at least for propulsion design, but I think this is included with an specific delta-V requirement in the propulsion section

children.text: BeetleSat spacecraft shall be compatible with any potential orbit inclination

The preliminary design of the constellation is:

  • 12x orbits with 22x LEO satellites in each orbit, at an altitude of 720Km
  • Delta RAAN between orbits is 30 deg.
  • Orbit inclination of 53.5° (North-East), allowing full coverage between the latitudes of ±62° (TBC)

The satellites shall be designed to meet all performance requirements specified in this document, after exposure to the corresponding pre-launch, ground operation, transportation, launch environments and lifetime in orbit until de-orbiting phase is concluded.
children.comments: FA->Requirement modified using the wording from AA´s- doc, as the definition in the RFI was not complete.

children.text: The system, subsystem and unit design and the test program shall be adequate to ensure that the combined conducted and radiated electromagnetic emissions from all sources shall not adversely affect the correct operation of the payload or degrade the performance of elements of the platform subsystems during all mission phases.
children.rationale: EMC shall be ensured

children.text: The equipment subject to potential failure due to thermal environment, plasma, solar environment, ionizing radiation or geomagnetic field, shall incorporate all the risk mitigation design alternatives to avoid failures
children.rationale: Graceful degradation and not catastrophic failure due to environmental conditions

children.text:
Prime contractor shall define the ground operations and handling requirements (for storage, Transport and in launcher facilites) including:

  1. Cleanness level
  2. ESD
  3. Humidity
  4. Temperature
  5. Transport conditions ( e.g. vibration levels or temperature)
  6. Transport package requirements
children.rationale: Controlled environmental conditions during all the life-cycle of the spacecraft at system, subsystem and even component level.

children.text: The satellite shall be designed to include internal and external ESD protection to eliminate discharge threat

Constellation launch strategy shall consider the use of dedicated launches, the use of ride-share launches along with other satellites or a combination of both as required for total constellation deployment cost/risk/time optimization.
children.comments: FA-> requirement modified from RFI for consistency with other requirements and the scope of the work

children.text: Prime Contractor shall consider in the design the interface and the stacking of multiple satellites in one launch in such a way that the number of packed satellites in a launch is optimised in function of the cost per satellite with respect to the cost of the total constellation launch
children.comments: FA-> Here, this work may imply consider a new design for the launcher inner ring, that is out of the scope of the project.

children.text: Launch design shall comply with the stacking of multiple satellites on a shared launch with at least 2 orbital planes per launch  (i.e. 44 satellites)
children.comments:
FA->This will depend on the strategy of the launch, that is a decision of the vendor as declared in other requirement. I will remove this requirement as contradicts the other

---SI NO HAY COMENTATIOS EN CONTRA ESTE REQUISITO SERÁ ELIMINADO---


MC->Responsibility needs to be clearly defined. Do not feel it is a PC full responsibility.

children.text: Full constellation launch plan shall include the means to spread the satellites within the constellation planes, either with on board propulsion or via the launcher phasing or any other strategy that optimizes total constellation deployment cost
The full constellation deployment plan shall include several launches
children.rationale: Reduces the risk of loosing all the spacecrafts manufactured due to launcher failure

children.text: The constellation deployment plan shall consider all the requirements of launch from every potential launch site.
children.comments: FA-> for an inclined orbit, launch from SpaceX port implies a high delta-V requirement for orbit inclination.
children.rationale: Pending on launch site, the delta-V required for constellation deployment can significantly change

children.text: If the internationall launcher availability allows it, then the constellation deployment plan shall consider the use of at least two different laucher providers
children.comments: FA->Cost/risk reduction should be also consider for this requirement?
children.rationale: Reduces the risk of loosing all the spacecrafts manufactured due to launcher failure in consecutive launches of the same launcher. May allow more aggressive deployment strategies.

children.text: The satellite interface to launcher shall be via a separation ring
children.comments:
FA-> What other meas are there? Should we remove this requirement as it seems not to provide any valuable information?

---SI NO HAY COMENTATIOS EN CONTRA ESTE REQUISITO SERÁ ELIMINADO---

MC->Probably comes from cubesat dispensers concepts. I would remove it.

children.text:
• The satellite shall be designed to be fully compatible (including launcher requirements and the launch site safety regulations) with the following launchers:
  1. SpaceX Falcon 9 or Falcon Heavy
  2. Space X Starship
  3. Blue Origin New Glenn 
  4. ULA Vulcan
  5. Vega C
  6. Ariane 6
  7. PSLV
children.comments:
FA->Are those compatible or conceive a solution for being compatible with all could impose a prohibitive cost?

MC->

Senseless. If they are also requiring to propose strategies for >1 launcher compatibility if available [1_URD-249], they cannot push to be compatible with all these (apart from the huge overcost). Proposal: as many as possible among… or at least X, Y, Z...

MC->Spin lauch is stating that they can put in orbit 10 sats of 200kg at 250k€, at around 500km

children.text: If the launcher allows it, then the satellites shall be turned on during launch and receive and send commands via an umbilical harness to the launcher.
children.comments:
FA->As indicated in SpaceX user guide, this is specifically FORBIDEN: rideshare payloads shall be switch-off during the whole launch and even a specified time after the deployment. I included the "if the launcher allows it" part

I would remove this, why should I want to use battery charge during the launch? Why I just simply turn on just right after launcher separation?

MC->Indeed, the opposite should be specified. Should be design to switch on under the event of the separation, according to the launcher restrictions

DG->Agree. Not sure if they refer prior to launch and if we have a dedicated launch just for us. IF that is the case we might have a basis status check prior to launch or something like that

---IF THERE ARE NO FURTHER COMMENTS THIS REQUIREMENT WILL BE REMOVED--------

children.text: The satellite shall be designed to meet all the requirements of launch from every potential launch site.
children.comments:
FA->Copied from AA´s Doc

MC->Repeated? If the difference is safety requirements vs general requirements, I would place this first and then the especific for safety.
children.rationale: Reduces the risk as being compatible with different launchers you can change "easily" w.r.t launch opportunities

children.text: A verification plan (including qualification campaign test plan and mass production validation test plan) shall be provided by the Prime Contractor and approved by the customer justifying its accordance to the specific space standards in which they were based
children.comments:
FA-> new wording from RFI, more complete and coherent with the scope of the work

MC->To verify the mass production process? Or are we talking about acceptance?

Validation is not the proper term.

children.text: When possible,the satellites shall be qualified by means of test to demonstrate compliance with spacecraft requirements during all phases of the mission.
children.comments:
FA-> Modified from original wording. I am not convinced about this requirement wording "be qualified" and overall requirement meaning. I would remove or change it

---IF THERE ARE NO FURTHER COMMENTS THIS REQUIREMENT WILL BE REMOVED--------

children.text: When verification by test is not possible, then the satellites shall be verified by analysis (including similarity), inspection or review of design.
children.comments:
FA->For completing the REQ-4300-MAN. I would remove both requirements (REQ-4300-MAN and this one) or at least re-wording needed.


---IF THERE ARE NO FURTHER COMMENTS THIS REQUIREMENT WILL BE REMOVED--------

children.text: A qualification satellite shall be developed for being used in the qualification campaign
The BeetleSat Qualification Satellite shall be identical to the final platform that will be used in the constellation
children.comments:
FT-> A analizar cuando entendamos cual es la estrategia de verificación para este tipo de misión

MC->Some things may not be identical? Example, thrusters don't have to be functional, but representative FA-> I would use a FM for propulsion subsystem for the qualification model
children.rationale: "Test what you fly and fly what you test" directive

children.text: If there are changes between the qualification satellite and final satellites used in the constellation, an evaluation of the changes shall be done, including all necessary delta qualifications, for ensuring compliance with all the satellite requirements.
children.comments:
FA-> Change control between what was qualified and what is flown

MC->Should be part of change control PAP policies?

children.text: The verification plan shall include a timeline of the tests and the physical location they will take place.
The verification plan shall define verification strategies and methods at subsystem level and at spacecraft level
children.comments: FA-> Complete re-wording of this requirement from RFI
children.rationale: Subsystem level and system level verification strategies are different and both shall be defined and consistent

children.text: Shipping spacecrafts to external testing facilities is not encouraged.
children.comments:
FA->For mass production validation it could make sense this statement, for qualification it would be really hard to comply with as there will be need of very specific facilities for each test. I would remove this

---SI NO HAY COMENTATIOS EN CONTRA ESTE COMENTARIO SERÁ ELIMINADO---

children.text:
The verification plan shall include at least the following qualification tests:

  1. Functional tests
  2. End-to-end testing of all subsystems and system level
  3. RF and intermission interference
  4. EMI/EMC and ESD
  5. Physical measurements like CG, MI, PI (Center of Gravity, Moments of Inertia, Products of inertia)
  6. Deployment tests
  7. Environmental conditions and testing including thermal vacuum and mechanical test that meets launcher and space environment requirements
  8. Integrated Antenna Radiated tests at satellite level
children.comments:
FA-> Complete the list? I have associated these tests to the qualification campaign, the acceptance campaign is not mentioned.

MC->Even for mass production acceptance, it is difficult to foresee in advance. I would just ask for a top level plan (and probably not in requirements, but in RFI document). Esto es pesca de arrastre…Yo pediría un plan, de acuerdo a recognized standards ECSS/NASA.

children.text: The prime contractor shall develop a flight-equivalent engineering model hardware of the spacecraft (Flat-Sat), including Engineering Models of all the subsystems and that is capable of running the same version of flight software that the Flight Model spacecrafts will do.
children.comments: FA-> This is in my mind what is the Flat-sat that we need. correct? Please, modify as required

children.text:
The Flat-Sat shall allow the following objectives:

  1. Be used as a platform for preliminary testing of integration procedures
  2. Preliminary electrical interface integration test-bed
  3. Be used for system-level  testing of the OBSW
  4. Preliminary avionics hardware/software functionality verification test-bed
  5. Fault protection testing platform
  6. FDIR testing platform
  7. Operational flight procedures testing
  8. Being used as platform for troubleshooting during LEOP
  9. Test-bed for personnel training
children.comments:
FA-> Complete the list with all the functionalities the Flat-sat shall have?

Besides the Flat-Sat, do we need simulators of any kind? "Full mission software simulation shall provide integrity of the algorithm to meet the pointing requirements utilizing the available sensors and actuators and taking into consideration the mass and inertia products of the spacecraft, angular momentum, solar stresses, etc"

MC->I agree. At least some parts of the flat-sat will need to be simulated (example, AOCS, operations,…). We can ask ASL how they manage it...I think a HW-in-the-loop approach could be very powerful to anticipate the physical behaviour.

N.P->

Por una parte lo que parece absolutamente necesario es un simulador a nivel de misión de la constelación completa que evalué los parámetros fundamentales (FoV, numero de satélite, modos de operación, fiabilidad, disponibilidad…)  para obtener las prestaciones de la constelación.

De esta tarea de sistema se deberán derivar requisitos tanto a la plataforma como las cargas de pago

Complementariamente al Flat-Sat serian necesario algún simulador a nivel de spacecraft que fundamente sirve para derivar requisitos a las unidades.

E.g reconfiguración en vuelo.

Luego a nivel de unidades o subsistemas también habrá simuladores y entornos de desarrollo (e.g AOCS) y estos se deberán entregar al prime.

Estos últimos también suelen ser equipos que intervienen en el FlatSat; EGSEs, SCOEs, simuladores de carga

children.heading: Operations, Control, Ground segment and Networking requirements

children.text: TT&C Server (in SOC) shall enable the full constellation management from the Ground Control Station.

children.text: Spacecraft main contractor shall define concept of geographical redundancy and configuration for all relevant ground systems, including the procedure for disaster recovery.
children.comments:
FA->Clearly a ground segment requirement

N.P->Esto para mi es un requisito de mision que engloba space and ground segment

children.comments:
FA->I don not understand this. It seems not a good idea: Implementation feasible or compatible with a secure link? Contradictory with following requirement

children.text: Prime Contractor shall propose the TT&C operation security concept
Hardware and software on the spacecraft and on ground shall be provided by the Prime Contractor.

FA->General and unspecific requirement, mixing ground and space segments: I do not know what to do with this 

N.P->No entiendo esto

children.text: The main contractor shall provide a software system, the Resource Management System (RMS), for the ground segment, able to control and monitor all payload operations, status and configurations.
children.comments: FA->Ground segment software development. I suppose the RMS is related with payload and the software for bus is other, but is not clear in their definition

children.text:
Resource Management System (RMS) shall support:

·       Download and real time monitor of the configuration and spectrum occupation of each satellite and the entire constellation system

·       Manage of log files and configuration history and the capability to retrieve old files, modify, and send them to the satellite for execution

·       Automated calibration procedures to support calibrated data readings on the ground such as input and output power levels, spectral density etc.

·       The vendor will provide the customer with comprehensive interface data in order to allow integration in higher level of command and control system furnished by the customer or its partners 

·       Simulation module to simulate new configurations before upload a command file to the satellites
Resource Management System (RMS) shall be supported for patching and essential enhancements for at least 10 (TBC) years following commencement.
children.comments:
FA->THis requirement could increase the cost drastically (10 years) and it is not well defined : what is a " essential enhancement"?

JM-> Life of the satellite is 5-7 years... This is another ground segment requirement

children.text: The prime contractor shall support Ground Control Station local installation of command and control servers, transmitters and receivers.
children.comments: FA->Ground segment activity. What is the scope of "support"?
