children.comments: FA->I understand it is related with the spacecraft health status in orbit? it should be clarified in the requirement

children.text: The prime contractor shall define a security measures and alerts plan that will be presented to the customer for approval.
children.comments: FA-> Is it related with the ground segment? I understand by the context that it is related with the operation phase (until commissioning that is where operation activities end for the prime contractor), but it is not clear. This requirements shall be re-written

children.text:
Prime contractor shall support spacecraft operations for entire mission lifetime in the following way:

  1. Provide training to Beetlesat personnel for the operations
  2. In orbit on-site support during the first year of the operations
  3. In orbit support in-plant including:
    1. Save, manage backed-up database, and analyze technical & operational data provided by telemetry stream
    2. Operate customer support center for any inquiry regarding the health of the satellite and constellation
    3. Establish ticketing system for any question or suspicious behavior raised by the customer or the satellite operations subcontractor
    4. Support any anomaly investigation in collaboration with the customer and/or operation vendor on customer’s behalf
    5. Hold monthly (yearly after the first year of operation) status meeting during operation phase
children.comments: FA-> training, support,etc.. generic. I do not understand the scope of this requirement

children.text: The vendor shall notify promptly to the customer regarding any equipment anomaly detected in other system provided by the vendor, that is similar, related or has possible some implications on the health, expected lifetime or level of service of the customer’s system
Prime contractor shall approve with the customer a Manufacturing, Assembly and Integration Plan covering the space segment for the entire constellation.
children.comments: FA->I include the Manufacturing part and remove the Test part as it is included in verification section. Also I delimit the scope to the space segment

children.text: Manufacturing, Assembly and Integration plan shall consider mass production techniques for reducing the cost and enabling the manufacturing of the large quantities of satellites in the time frame of the project.
children.comments: MC->These techniques shall be defined from the start of the development and they should be duly justified and respalded by enough data and analyses. (Same for acceptance testing - lot approaches)
children.rationale: MAI procedures for mass production are highly complex but are critical for the project success so they shall be considered from the design phase and verified accordingly

children.text: Manufacturing, assembly and integration plans, procedures and techniques that will be used in the constellation development shall be used for the qualification satellite assembly and integration in such a way the qualification campaign could be used for manufacturing, assembly and integration qualification.
children.comments:
FA-> TBC pending on verification strategy

MC->Key to have enough guarantees. Difficult to believe that we will get to such point on just 1 QM attempt (design + mass production, first time& 1 run).


Maybe considering that first mass produced sats will be PFM is a winner strategy.

children.text: If after qualification campaign, new Manufacturing, Assembly and Integration plans, techniques or procedures are introduced in the production line, then the prime contractor shall conduct the adequate delta qualification tests for ensuring the spacecraft performance is not compromised.

If different manufacturing facilities are used for constellation mass production, then the prime contractor shall ensure the same or equivalent Manufacturing, Assembly and Integration plans, procedures, equipment and qualified personnel are exactly followed in each facility.
children.rationale: If we are considering MAIT split in two facilities (ASL and Arquimea) then we shall consider the same result is obtained from both ensuring the same procedures

children.heading: Packaging, transportation, handling and storage requirements

children.text: The spacecraft shall be designed for secure and safe handling during assembly and transportation to the designated launch site and storage facility (if required).
children.comments: Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc

children.text: The shipping containers shall be instrumented to record, as a minimum, the temperatures, humidity, and accelerations to which the spacecraft is subjected during transportation and storage.
children.comments: Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc

children.text: Prime contractor is responsible for User Manual generation, distribution and maintenance to spacecraft users.

The bus shall host two payloads:

  1. Primary payload, corresponding to the payload required for BettleSat communication network implementation
  2. Secondary hosted payload for different uses with a total mass of less than 10Kg and a OAP consumption lower than 30W
children.comments:
FA->power included in the figure of power provided in later requirements??

Volume of the secondary payload? other relevant characteristics

FT-> es posible que esto de la payload adicional este asociada al IOT. A preguntar a NSL, de momento no darle mucha relevancia

children.text: The bus shall support all the payload needs including power and data transfer operations.
children.comments:
FA-> Modified from RFI

MC-> Too generic = do not give information

FA-> ERASE THIS REQUIREMENT IF THERE ARE NOT FURTHER COMMENTS

children.text: When the satellite is in an operative mode and the payload is active, the spacecraft shall ensure that the communications to ground payload (USLs) are always pointing to Earth.
When the satellite is in an operative mode and the payload is active, the satellite shall not require manoeuvring for inter-satellite link engagement.
When the satellite is in an operative mode and the payload is active, the satellite shall maintain ISL connection at all times
children.comments:
FA-> Modified from RFI

MC->There are switching times + MEO/GEO pointing capabilities.

children.text: The prime contractor shall define, in agreement with customer, the spacecraft operational modes compatible with payload and bus requirements.
While the spacecraft is in sunlight or in eclipse conditions the satellite design shall allow full operation, including propulsion maneuvers, without limitation.

The OBC shall be able of controlling and monitoring:

  1. Primary and secondary payloads (including OBC-SDR direct bus interface)
  2. All the platform systems and subsystems.

The  TT&C communication system with ground stations shall provide the necessary access to the satellite for monitoring, control and distance measurement in nominal and emergency modes, throughout all mission phases including: ground system testing, pre-launch, launch, transfer and drift orbits, on-station, repositioning, inclined orbit and reorbitation

The satellite shall include on-board data processing capability to realise the following functions:

  1. Management, decoding, direct execution, and distribution of the commands
  2. Acquisition, processing and formatting of the telemetered satellite data
  3. Real-time clock operation (time management and time-tagged command management)
  4. Execution of autonomous process 
  5. Automatic on board switching to emergency mode
  6. The satellite shall perform failure detection, isolation, and recovery (FDIR) management at system, subsystem, and equipment levels
  7. Autonomous event reporting
The satellite shall provide mechanisms to avoid or recover from any conflict that can arise from the execution of on­board autonomous actions and TCs.
OBDH shall provide on board autonomy, without performances degradation, for TBD hours without ground access
Prime contractor shall select the space-link frequency band between platform and ground stations used for the TT&C
Spacecraft OBDH shall be able of using the inter-satellite link for Telemetry and Telecommand of the spacecraft
children.comments:
FA->Should we consider alternative approaches for easing the TM&TC of the constellation using the ISL capabilities? Certainly is not a platform decision, but it seems a desirable possibiliity in case in future it would be needed for commanding 250 satellites with few TC& TM stations

FT-> A analizar esta posibilidad con AA y NSL primero

children.text:
OBDH shall provide time tag commanding capability with the following characteristics:

  1. To program all critical operations in advance
  2. To program up to TBD commands
  3. To program command execution for TBD days
  4. Deletion of time tag commands one by one
Telemetry and telecommand of the spacecraft shall be compliant with CCSDS standards.
Telemetry and telecommand of the BeetleSat platform shall be encrypted using AES-256 with key exchange
OBDH shall consider and alternative band using the payload USL for spacecraft Telecommand and Telemetry (Backup for TT&C using the USL Ka band)
children.comments:
FA->I think this is NOT a good idea: use USL for TM and TC is not secure, unnecessary and very expensive. It may be considered the option of using the IS for passing TC between Spacecrafts, but never using the USL.

IN AA´s doc is specifically forbidden : "The Contractor shall design the TBD-band TCR independently from payload equipment, exception made of the communication antennae"

children.text: The OBDH subsystem shall include High Priority Command and Critical Telemetry capabilities without the need of any intervention of the OnBoard Software running in the OBC.
children.comments:
N.P->Ojo con esto. Lo podemos dejar asi pero lo debemos tener en cuenta cuando definamos los HPC.

He visto muchas NCR con este tema y eso es dinero tambien

children.text: No single failure within the OBDH subsystem shall prevent the acceptance and execution of a HPC
The range and resolution of each telemetry channel shall be compatible with the expected range of variation of the data being telemetered.

Telemetry data shall be provided, for the ground segment to determine the status of the spacecraft subsystems and payloads and to monitor the execution of nominal and anticipated contingency operations, including at least the following:

  1. sensor readings,
  2. Memories readouts (including registers)
  3. equipment status (including power status), 
  4. function status, 
  5. reports of on­board events and actions taken by autonomous functions, 
  6. and processor and memory auto­test results (BITs)
  7. Configuration tables
All spacecraft critical telemetry shall be redundant

When sufficient power is applied to the bus and not short-circuit condition is detected, the command subsystem shall be permanently connected to the spacecraft's electrical bus using hot redundancy and shall be fully operational
children.comments: FA->Modified completely using re-wording from AA´s doc and new wording. Maybe is worthy consider the nominal/redundant condition failure here

children.text: The command subsystem shall provide all the necessary control of the spacecraft's configuration, position, and attitude by receiving, decoding, and executing ground-generated commands during all phases of the mission
Failure in the acceptance or the execution of commands originating on­board shall be notified to the ground segment by means of anomaly event reports.
The OBDH subsystem shall provide ranging function in the purpose of determining the distance between the satellite and any ground station
Prime contractor shall define the digital bus needs for On Board Data Handling including redundancy strategy
children.comments: FA-> bus capabilities of the OBDH shall be analysed

children.text: OBDH shall provide Data Storage function for storage of data needed for the spacecraft operation, including but not restricted to: Volatile and Non-volatile Memories, Safe-Guard Memories, Booting mechanism and mass memories as required for comply with spacecraft requirements of this document.
children.comments: FA-> Data storage function of the OBDH shall be considered

children.text:
FDIR shall provide for the following capabilities:

  1. FDIR monitoring functions can be enabled or inhibited by ground command
  2. FDIR monitoring thresholds (including those associated with automatic failure detection) can be modified by ground command
  3. FDIR shall permit to reconfigure autonomously any equipment identified as failed, without subsystem or system block switching
  4. FDIR shall permit to reconfigure autonomously a subsystem identified as failed, without system block switching
  5. FDIR shall permit to reconfigure at system level if system monitoring functions are identified as failed.
  6. FDIR reconfiguration programs shall be reprogrammable by ground command (i.e., payload shedding sequence).
  7. Status and responses to all FDIR functions shall be included in normal telemetry
  8. FDIR activities performed on­board shall be reported in an unambiguous manner to the ground segment ( including the cause of an on­board reconfiguration ). The reporting of FDIR activities shall contain all information for failure analysis (e.g. time of occurrence, parameter out­-of-­limit or switching performed)
  9. FDIR shall provide functions to isolate the failed unit or subsystem, to avoid failure propagation and deterioration of the impacted equipment
  10. If an on­board failure detection function identifies an anomalous situation, it shall trigger autonomous recovery actions consistent with the specific mission needs without ground segment intervention
  11. The spacecraft shall enter a safe state if any hazard exists that affects spacecraft or payload health or mission objectives
  12. The spacecraft shall not enter survival mode if no hazard exists that affects spacecraft or payload health or mission objectives
  13. Recovery from survival mode shall be undertaken under ground control
All the critical satellite survival automatic control loops shall be overridable by commands providing that the ground reaction time is compatible with control loop requirements
children.comments:
FA->Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc

It makes sense that if there is need of any survival automatic action, it could be changed from ground

children.text: Telemetry shall be provided to enable detection and diagnosis of any failure identified during the failure analysis phase (e.g. as defined in the FMECA) at least down to function or equipment level.
The failure analysis capability shall be provided to record diagnostic mode data on­board for later retrieval by the ground segment.
The OBDH shall be designed to enable the detection of spacecraft degradation and anomalous performance during all phases of the mission
The telemetered data of the telemetry format shall permit unambiguously to know the current status of all the satellite functions and to perform fault isolation in case of abnormal operation

The satellite shall be designed with the capability to operate all primary and redundant subsystems, equipment and items, minimizing interruption and/or degradation of communications, including , but not be limited to, the ability to command on and off the alternative means of performing a function.
children.comments:
FA->Derived from Antonio Abad´s document

DG->No sé si este requisito va a derivarse hacia abajo en otros. No vamos a tener redundancia en todo o casi todo como en el old space FA-> Entiendo se refieren, no a redundar todo, si no a lo que exista redundado poder operarlo de forma flexible

children.text: The prime contractor shall define the spacecraft level autonomy in function of overall constellation management strategy.
children.comments: FA->Defining the required autonomy of the platform will be the first step for defining the OBDH. This autonomy will depend on how we would like to telecommand the constellation (using ISL?, using autonomous procedures implemented in the ground segment?)

children.text: The OBSW shall manage the satellite operational modes, monitor the satellite health status, and implement the operational activities to be executed by the satellite.
children.comments: FA->This requirement do not provide valuable information.Re-wording needed

children.text: The OBSW shall execute the received telecommands and shall acquire, date, pack and send the telemetry data to the TT&C subsystem
children.comments: FA->This requirement do not provide valuable information.Re-wording needed

children.text:
While the spacecraft is in orbit, it shall be possible to update/load new OBSW images without interruption of the spacecraft scheduled activity.

Where there are programable components in the spacecraft (as the OBC or the payload OBSW) those shall be able of being modified in orbit (over-the-air update capability)
children.comments:
N.P->Ojo! no todo el SW puede ni debe ser reprogramable en orbita solo una parte de él, generalmente el Application SW

Esto para mi es un req de operación, no deberia ir aqui

Sobre solicitar que se haga sin interrupción: Lo podemos pedir pero implica un coste ya que requiere que todo el OBSW tenga la misma categoría. 

El proceso se cambio de software implica una reconfiguración con una estrategia a nivel de constelación que habría que pensar partiendo del hecho que el SW de todos los satelites es el mismo.

Opino que para esto debería hacer un modo particular (en el cual se ejecuta un SW de "mas calidad")

children.text:
Over-the-air update capability shall be implemented by two different ways:

  1. Telecommand using platform OBDH subsystem
  2. Telecommand using payload USL Ka band
children.comments:
FA-> I think this is not a good idea: use USL for TM and TC is not secure, unnecessary and very expensive. It may be considered the option of using the ISL for passing TC between Spacecrafts, but not using the USL


F.T -> Se consulta esta opción de TM& TC a través del USL con A.A y de momento no se deriva a ASL

DG->Quizá se refieran a actualizar el Payload a través de su propio enlace?

children.text: The OBSW system must include a fault detection and failure prevention system to automatically reconfigure the control system utilizing redundant systems.
children.comments: FA->Re-wording needed. I think this functuoinality is already covered in FDIR & reconfiguration section

children.text: The OBSW TM/TC shall be implemented according to the ESA Packet Utilisation Standard
The OBSW shall allow Filesystem and file transmission protocol (FTP-like)
The satellite shall implement an attitude control mechanism to enable payload performance.
children.comments:
FA->I would erase this requirement. Does not add any valuable additional information and it is difficult to verify "payload performance". no attitude control for other reasons? just for payload?

--IF THERE ARE NOT FURTHER COMMENTS THIS REQUIREMENT WILL BE REMOVED----

children.text: The ADCS shall consist of all hardware and software used to determine and control (three-axis stabilisation) all satellite and antenna pointing states during all mission phases to meet all system requirements
The ADCS shall meet its performance requirements without requiring the use of any ground-based RF reference signal source
When the satellite is in a mode ready for functional operation with the payload active the spacecraft shall ensure a pointing accuracy to Nadir of 0.15º (TBC)
children.comments: FA->Is this the correct way of defining a pointing requirement or it is missed information in this requirement definition?

children.text: It shall be possible to control by ground command, at any time, each of the ADCS actuators individually
The ADCS design shall include safe modes and safety features to assure the safety of the spacecraft
The ADCS shall be fully redundant with full cross-strapping capability between the ADCS units

The calibrated attitude determination system shall provide three-axis attitude data consistent with a body roll, pitch and yaw attitude pointing accuracy of better than TBD degrees in each axis, for periods up to TBD hours without requiring any new calibration

The ADCS shall provide autonomous control, as required, to orient and maintain the attitude of the satellite such that the firing of the perigee motor delivers the required velocity increment (magnitude and direction) during all in-orbit phases of the mission.

Normal operations (between TBD station-keeping operations) shall utilise on-board processing to autonomously generate all control and actuation signals to maintain the specified pointing accuracy. All the on-board automatic functions shall be overridable by ground command
The ADCS design shall include the capability for reacquisition of the satellite and antenna pointing attitudes at any time of the orbital life after loss of control
The ADCS design shall not impose time-of-year constraints on the execution of station-keeping maneuvers
The satellite shall be able to control the attitude with constant bias
children.comments: FA->Copied from AA´s doc. I do not fully understand what is "constant bias"

children.text:
When the satellite enters in any safe mode, following the defined safe modes directives defined during the design phase, the Attitude Control Subsystem shall permit:

  1. Minimise communication outages
  2. Maximise solar panel irradiation

The ADCS design shall incorporate automatic onboard provisions to ensure that single failure of any actuator or sensor (including onboard processing of acquired data) will not cause loss of nadir pointing
children.comments: FA->Copied from AA´s doc. I do not  understand what is "earth lock", I think is related with GEO sats and not applicable to LEO?

children.heading: Propulsion and Orbit maintenance Subsystem Requirements

children.text: The propulsion subsystems shall include all propellant/pressurant components and assemblies associated with storing, conditioning, routing, controlling and expelling propellant, as required to change the satellite attitude and its angular or linear velocity to meet the mission requirements, from the moment of separation from the launch vehicle up to the end of the orbital life, including the orbit raising maneuver and de-orbiting.

The thrusters qualification shall permit to perform, for all mission phases after launcher separation in nominal and contingency configurations, all the attitude control (with and without attitude bias), bias setting, orbit repositioning, collision avoidance, de-orbiting and station keeping maneuvers (with and without attitude bias) required through the lifetime, while guaranteeing stable attitude control

BeetleSat spacecraft shall provide enough Delta V capabilities for maneuvering for:

  1. Constellation deployment
  2. Station keeping
  3. Collision avoidance
  4. De Orbiting
NSL has estimated, in a prelimnary analysis, a required Delta-V of 250 m/s
TBD delta-V margins for contingency shall be considered

Prime Contractor shall analyse the redundancy of the propulsion subsystem and propose an architecture that could maximise the reliability of the system while maintaining the cost under the requirements for the spacecraft
children.comments: FA-> redundancy/cost is a complex trade-off for this satellite and the propulsion subsystem. It must be well analysed and justified

children.text: The orbit inclination of the satellite shall not exceed ±TBD degrees with respect to the equatorial plane and the longitude of the satellite shall not exceed ±TBD degrees with respect to the nominal longitude at any time during the orbital life.
Throughout the orbital lifetime, remaining useful propellant mass estimation shall be available through simple telemetry processing

The propellant mass available for the propulsion subsystem shall cover all the operations required by the orbit and attitude control from launcher separation, up to the completion of the de-orbiting maneuvers
Propellant mass shall include a mass contingency TBD to accommodate all the performance dispersion and thruster performance evolution against life
All welds or joints of the propulsion subsystem, including its components, exposed to fluids or gas at any time of the life of the spacecraft shall be proof tested
children.comments:
FA->Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc

MC->Future: We can check for the specific ECSS and see if can be more detailed.

children.text: Propellant loss from single failure at valve/thruster level shall not cause loss of attitude
children.comments: FA->Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc. Chemical related req.

children.text: The design and operations of the propulsion subsystems shall be compatible with the launcher and launch site safety regulations

Firing of thrusters shall not cause: any detrimental effect on attitude, degradation of surfaces due to erosion, loss of thermo-dynamical properties, change in profiles due to condensations, chemical contamination, degradation of batteries or solar arrays.
The use of the electrical propulsion subsystem shall not harm, in any way, any spacecraft located at a minimum distance of TBD km
children.comments:
FA->Copied from Antonio Abad´s doc. Applicable for smallsat? 

MC-> remove?

children.text: The electromagnetic compatibility of the electric propulsion subsystem with the satellite shall be ensured and demonstrated
The use of the propulsion subsystem shall not generate charging of the satellite or any of its parts
In case multiple electric thrusters are used simultaneously, the mutual effects of electrostatic and magnetic fields on thrusters and subsystem performance shall be assessed
The Power Processing Unit (PPU) shall be fully compatible, including EMC and ESD aspects, with the rest of the spacecraft.
Grounding and insulation of the propulsion subsystem shall be implemented to limit interferences with other satellite systems to within allowable levels.

To ensure compatibility among main elements of the electric propulsion subsystem, a complete functional chain of these units (i.e. thruster, flow control, power supply, filters¡) must have been tested together during subsystem qualification
The electric propulsion subsystem testing shall also cover transient effects, like effect of pressure stability of propellant fed to the thrusters.

Life test of a complete functional chain shall be conducted according to the mission duty cycles and mission representative thermal conditions, inlcuding life margins. The health status of the system shall be monitored during the life test
Transients generated by the PPU shall not result in abort of firing or loss of attitude
In case thrust interruptions cannot be avoided, the design of the thrusters shall be such that if interruptions are experienced they do not degrade life or performance
The plume shall not have any detrimental effect on payload operation or on RF performance or stability
If a multi-tank design is implemented, inadvertent propellant transfer between tanks shall be prevented by design
The thermal control of the subsystem, including the tanks, shall be sized to avoid reaching the critical point of the propellant under any flight condition

The electrical power subsystem shall generate, store, condition, and distribute the electrical power required to ensure that the satellite meets all performance requirements during all phases of the mission
The design shall include solar array to provide electrical power during operation in sunlight, and a battery system to provide all electrical power required during operation in eclipse

Prime contractor shall define the EPS architecture and design for ensuring the following main objectives:

  1. Maximise the power available for the payloads
  2. Minimise the cost, mass and volume of the overall satellite
children.comments: FA->The bus shall compete in the market with its power capabilities w.r.t the cost and mass of to other solutions
children.rationale: Main objective for the platform is present the best power/cost relation in the market

children.text:
The platform shall provide to the payload an OAP not less than:

  • 400 W for the primary payload
  • 30W for the secondary hosted payload
children.comments: FA->I am assuming the 30W of the secondary payload are not included in the 400W declared in the RFI

children.text: The satellite power system shall support a continuous payload and platform power consumption in any potential payload configuration.

The power subsystem shall be designed, manufactured and tested to meet worst case power requirements of all satellite modes of operation including any transient power required for fault clearing and transient loads
No single point failure in the power subsystem shall prevent from satisfying the load requirements and no single part failure shall open or short electrical power bus
EPS main functions shall be controlled by onboard automatisms to ensure autonomy
The spacecraft shall support solar arrays sun pointing in all operational modes (except for de-tumbling mode)
The power system shall consider all possible solar panels illumination states such as: eclipse/sun attitude of the satellite, panel illumination issue, seasons, and sun angles.
Payload operational modes duty cycle TBD
children.comments: FA-> Payload power consumption profile ROM has not being provided properly by NSL

children.text: Solar panels lifetime degradation shall be considered for the power subsystem design.
children.comments:
FA->I will remove this requirement. it is implicit in the standard design process. 

---SI NO HAY COMENTATIOS EN CONTRA ESTE REQUISITO SERÁ ELIMINADO---

children.text: The power subsystem shall be able of swiching on and off all payload susbystems independently as commanded by the OBC or by HPC.
All parts at an electrical potential different than the structure shall have a double insulation with respect to the structure

The solar arrays shall include 2 degrees of freedom for ensuring solar array orientation perpendicular to the sun during all the days of the year:

  1.  a Solar Array Driving Mechanism, for orientation along orbit 
  2. at satellite level, rotating axis at nadir, for seasonal orientation
Cell performance and degradation factors shall be justified according to in orbit experience and supporting ground testing
All solar array sections connection status shall be available in TM
Solar array available power shall be available through simple telemetry processing
Solar array panels shall be equipped with TBD number of thermistors for temperature monitoring
The active area of each cell shall be fully protected by cover glass or other means to provide radiation protection
Shadowing and hot spot failure modes shall be taken into account in the design
Solar array strings/circuits/sections shall be routed to avoid any risk of arcing between adjacent strings/circuits/sections. This shall be demonstrated by analysis
The solar array shall be able to withstand electrostatic space charging of TBD nA/cm2 of TBD keV electron flux
Solar cell circuits shall be mutually isolated, avoiding any failure propagation
The ungrounded ends of the solar cell strings shall be isolated from the bus
The predicted power output in the worst case conditions at end of orbital life shall exhibit a TBD % positive margin over the worst case load required
TBD solar array sections currents shall be available in Telemetry
Solar array design shall incorporate all the necessary barrier to avoid ESD and ESD effects propagation in all the components (e.g.: yoke, harness, panel substrate, solar cells)

Prime Contractor shall define and justify the worst case conditions used for solar arrays design, including at least:

  1. TBD number of strings failed per wing
  2. UV radiation
  3. Micrometeoroid degradation
  4. Radiation degradation
  5. Aging: Consideration of the solar cycle peak versus satellite lifetime to determine worst case solar cells degradation profile since BOL
  6. cell mismatch
  7. ALE
  8. Temperature of operation
Batteries shall be designed for at least 40,000 (TBC) charge/discharge cycles
children.comments:
FA-> The main problem is the number of cycles. This number will depend on the lifetime. Consider remove this requirement or reduce its priority. The number of cycles will be derived in low-level requirements anyway

---SI NO HAY COMENTATIOS EN CONTRA ESTE REQUISITO SERÁ ELIMINADO---

children.text: Batteries shall be able to supply power demands during launch sequence, eclipse, peak power demands exceeding solar array capability of power generation (including station keeping maneuvers with electric propulsion) and emergency and safe modes.
The design of the satellite shall allow for removal and replacement of the batteries without affecting the acceptance status of the rest of the satellite

While considering the nominal maximum power consumption of the platform and payload, the batteries shall be sized such that following the longest Sun eclipse discharge period, there is always sufficient energy left to support the spacecraft in the event of a loss of attitude and acquisition of a safe mode
Battery characteristics shall be selected to ensure that the required battery performance is met over the service life
If flight proven cells and cell module designs can not be used, then the prime contractor shall justify the batteries selection and the verification process to be followed for qualification
children.comments: FA-> Maybe we can not use flight-proven batteries due to the complex restrictions imposed

children.text: Prime Contractor shall justify the Depth of Discharge  of the lowest from nameplate or measured capacity for each battery in the worst case conditions (maximum load, temperature, ...) throughout the orbital lifetime with (TBD) cell modules failed from BOL per battery. Degradation and ageing effects shall be considered in the calculations
Total battery voltage shall be available in Telemetetry
Individual cell voltages shall be available in Telemetetry
Temperature sensors shall be installed in all cell modules and shall be available simultaneously on Telemetetry
Battery cells shall be equipped with nominal and redundant heater circuits for thermal control.
Battery thermal control shall be designed to maximize the available capacity and minimize the cells wear out.
The functional connection of the batteries to the main primary buses shall be automatically achieved using the adequate means for protection
Prime contractor shall design the rate of charge for ensuring lifetime of the batteries for the whole mission.
Prime contractor shall define the batteries module redundancy and interconnection for ensuring mission requirements
Battery recharge shall be implemented by automatic means with commands back‑up with full monitoring by telemetry. This automatic function shall be overridable by ground command
Each battery cell shall be protected against open circuit by means of by‑pass devices
Battery cell mismatch shall be lower than 3% (TBC) for each battery
Power bus latching to the batteries at eclipse exit shall be avoided

The power subsystem shall incorporate the following features:

  1. Smooth automatic transition from solar array power to battery power and vice versa
  2. Bus voltage TBD ±TBD% independently of the operating conditions
  3. The bus shall be able to operate, keeping stability margins, with the payload operating in any configuration mode
  4. Protection of the electrical power subsystem from failures in the satellite loads during launch and orbit phases for both sunlight and eclipse conditions
  5. Control of bus voltages operational range, consistent with the requirements of all operating conditions
  6. Capability of operation with all required loads connected simultaneously
  7. Umbilical connectors to supply externally provided and pre-launch operations
  8. Capability of providing the worst case currents required for fault clearing or for transient loads
  9. The power conditioning units shall be able to condition and distribute the maximum power which can be generated by the solar array throughout the spacecraft lifetime
  10. The power conditioning unit shall have an overvoltage protection to protect the bus
children.comments:
FA->Copied from AA´s doc

MC->Something about the type of protection (Re-armable,…)?

children.text: Communications payload and nonessential loads that are not critical for satellite survival, may automatically shut down when the bus voltage decreases below the normal operational range. This shall be demonstrated by analysis and test

Such under-voltage switch off shall ensure that these loads do not operate under conditions that would damage or permanently degrade their performance, reliability or life. The shutdown sequence shall ensure that the loads disconnected are not damaged or degraded in performance, reliability or life by the automatic shutdown. sequence

Equipment providing essential housekeeping such as, but not limited to, ADCS or thermal control regulation shall remain connected to electrical bus unless removed by ground command.This equipment shall be designed to provide full performance capability of essential functions down to a bus voltage at least 1 V  below the worst case nonessential load switch off voltage and shall not be damaged or stressed by any continuously applied voltage down to 0V.
Power bus over-voltage conditions shall not damage or permanently degrade the performance, reliability, or life of any of the satellite load
Satellite bus power consumption shall be available through simple telemetry processing
Powering of the bus by the batteries shall be automatic
Onboard battery management under capacity criteria shall be provided to avoid full discharge of the batteries
Ground command override capability to isolate individual battery discharge regulators shall be provided

Prime contractor shall ensure and justify that all harness used in the spacecraft:

  1. Is compatible with all mission phases environment
  2. Complies with EMC and ESD restrictions
  3. Insulation is adequate for all mission phases
children.comments: FA-> Any other harness top level requirement? Maybe marking?

children.text: The thermal design of the spacecraft shall maintain payload and platform subsystems in their operating temperature range with sufficient margins during pre-launch operation, launch, separation sequences, transfer orbit, and operational orbit for all operating modes over the service life of the satellite
The satellite thermal control shall allow any payload operational configuration (balanced and worst case unbalanced cases).
The satellite shall incorporate temperature sensing mechanisms for platform and payload temperature monitoring and be able of transmitting to ground this data.
Thermal control shall be achieved primarily by passive means; that is, excluding moving parts, but allowing heaters.
Where heaters are required to control critical component temperatures, the heaters and associated controllers shall be functionally redundant
The capability shall be provided for the ground segment to enable and disable each individual thermal control loop

The thermal subsystem shall be designed to maintain predicted in orbit temperatures within the limits used to define operating conditions for other subsystems. To this end, the satellite shall be designed to meet all the performance requirements based on the worst case predicted in orbit temperatures with a design margin of TBD ºC
All blankets and external thermal control surfaces shall be grounded to protect the satellite from charging effects

The thermal design of the spacecraft shall take into account the degradation of the thermal control items over service life. Degradation factors shall include, but not be limited to, solar absorption and plume impingement
The thermal properties of EOL should be used for worst-case analysis, except in cases where the EOL properties will be more defrayable.

The thermal design and control of the propulsion subsystem shall ensure that the thermal environment does not allow the formation of ice in any of the subsystem components under any nominal and contingency operational configuration and shall implement the necessary thermal sensors to accurately monitor the temperatures
Prime contractor shall identify all payload components critical for the mission success and those shall be equipped with thermistors.
children.comments: FA->Derived from AA´s doc for limiting the number of thermistors to be used

children.text: The temperature of the batteries shall be controlled only by onboard software with thermal thresholds that can be set from ground telecommand
children.comments: Copied from AA´s doc. What happen with auto-freeze out? i.e. if the batteries are frozen, they will never unfroze if OBC does not work?

children.text:
The temperature control system shall be sized to take into account the following elements:

  1. Equipment extreme temperatures (operational and non operational).
  2. All possible equipment operating conditions
  3. Worst case degradation factor of the thermo‑optical elements over the orbital life

The structure shall provide support to all the equipment and subsystems of the satellite and shall be designed to withstand all the direct and cumulative loads combinations encountered during qualification or acceptance testing, handling, transportation, launch and life in orbit without exceeding the yield and ultimate limits.
The structure shall be designed to provide a successful separation from the launcher
Spacecraft form factor and structure shall be designed for complying with payload requirements and envelope optimisation for launch campaign needs
children.rationale: If possible, it will be relevant to optimise packing of several spacecrafts together in the launcher

children.text: Main resonance frequencies and modes shall be identified and verified at component, equipment, subsystem and system (spacecraft) level
The first eigenfrequency shall be greater than TBD Hz.
children.comments: MC->Not sure if it should be specified for different mission stages (stowed/launch configuration vs in-orbit). Launcher will impose fn for launch config.

children.text: The structure shall provide a minimum stiffness requirement to minimize the coupling with the launcher
children.comments:
FA->Copied from AA´s doc

MC->Linked to [1_URD-500]. Should be either unified or at least consider compatibility between the values chosen.

children.text: The structure shall provide during the orbital life a dimensional stability and alignment stability compatible with the mission requirements
The structure shall be designed such as to provide access for mounting and dismounting of the equipment minimising the operations required for it.
Interaction between the attitude and orbit controls and the appendages shall also be minimized

The structure sizing shall be such that there is no degradation of performances requirements of the platform and payload structure during its operational life and shall take into consideration at least:

  1. The general loads
  2. The local loads concerning the main appendages
  3. The stiffness requirements
  4. The environmental conditions
  5. Alignments and pointing requirements
  6. Stability requirements
The status of mechanisms shall be telemetered without reliance on secondary effects for observation

Mechanisms shall be designed with a positive margin of safety against yielding and ultimate loads under all environmental and operational load conditions. The actual stress or load shall be considered at their worst case qualification level. The margin of safety shall employ ECSS factors of safety (ECSS-E-ST-33-01C for mechanisms and ECSS-E-ST-32-10C for any other structural factors).
Mechanisms shall be designed with a positive margin of safety against motorization loads under all environmental and operational load conditions, including qualification, as per ECSS-E-ST-33-01C.
Failure of one part or element shall not result in consequential damage to the equipment or other spacecraft components

When possible, the design of equipment utilising slip-ring and brushes devices for power transfer shall be avoided being the prime contractor responsible of justify its use when no other solution was available
The mechanical design shall incorporate provisions to minimize the loads to which ball bearing suspension systems are subjected during launch
Any lubrication of the bearing system must use a state of the art technology compatible with the mission requirements.

Deployment mechanisms required to establish the in-orbit satellite configuration, such as those associated with solar arrays and antennas, shall be designed so as to provide a high degree of design margins and reliability following ECSS-E-ST-33-01C standard.
To be completed in following Draft version
children.comments: FA->Under development. Derive top-level SADA requirements from RFI sent to Honeybee
